title: Business Live: Euro near three-year high - BBC News
summary: growth next year will be weakest since 2008-09 recession , says bcc .
chinese firm buys stake in russia 's rosneft .
trinity mirror in talks to buy express newspaper .
thomas cook pilots strike and plan more .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's all from the business live page for the week .
please join us again on monday from 06:00 uk time .

documents.title: wall street flat as irma approaches florida
text: us stocks closed broadly flat , as investors assessed the financial impact of storm harvey and tracked hurricane irma as it moved towards florida .
the dow jones industrial average was higher - finishing at 21,798 points - helped by a rise in financial stocks as us treasury yields rebounded from 10-months lows .
the nasdaq composite declined to 6,360 , pulled lower by apple and comcast .
the s & p 500 was little changed at 2,461 .

documents.title: irma damage 'exceeds $ 10bn '
text: hurricane irma has caused more than $ 10bn ( £ 7.6bn ) in damage across the caribbean so far , according to disaster risk experts .
that would make it the costliest storm ever to hit the region , the centre for disaster management and risk reduction technology said .
the estimate does not include damage in the dominican republic or cuba , which are later in the storm 's path (
irma has left a trail of destruction in the caribbean , affecting an estimated 1.2m people , and is now heading towards florida in the us .

documents.title: lawmakers target equifax after data breach
text: us lawmakers have attacked credit report giant equifax after the company revealed that 143 million us customers may have had their information stolen in a data breach .

`` every breach leaves consumers exposed and vulnerable to identity theft , fraud and a host of other crimes , and they deserve answers , '' said rep jeb hensarling , who leads the house financial services committee .
the breach - one of the biggest ever reported in the us - puts people at risk for identity theft and other forms of fraud .
state prosecutors said they would investigate and a congressional committee is reportedly planning to hold a hearing .

documents.title: he made netflix , now he 's hacking movie night
text: do you remember blockbuster video ?
mitch lowe does .
and he remembers what they said to him as he set about putting them out of business with redbox , the movie rental company .
they said 'wait a minute , we rent movies for $ 5 .
you ca n't make money renting them for a dollar ! ' ''
`` the year i left we did $ 1.5bn in revenue .
blockbuster does n't exist any more . ''
read more here .
author: Dave Lee
North America technology reporter

documents.title: euro pulls back from 32 month high
text: the euro is is still up against the dollar at $ 1.203 , but has pulled back slightly from a high of $ 1.2091 earlier .

documents.title: bitcoin falls
text: bitcoin has fallen sharply -more than 7 % - after a report from a chinese news outlet said china was planning to shut down local crypto-currency exchanges .
analysts said this was just a temporary setback .

documents.title: us seeks to jail shkreli , citing 'pattern of threats '
text: us prosecutors have asked a judge to jail martin shkreli while he awaits sentencing for securities fraud , after a facebook post by the former drug company executive about hillary clinton prompted an investigation by the us secret service .

`` [ mr ] shkreli has engaged in an escalating pattern of threats and harassment that warrant his detention pending sentencing , '' prosecutors said in a filing in brooklyn federal court late on thursday .

documents.title: shanghai takes hard line on soft cheese
text: shanghai has halted the import of cheeses such as roquefort , brie and camembert in a move that could damage european exporters , reuters reports .
such cheeses are made with microbiological cultures that are not authorised in china , but the country has allowed them to come in for years , it said .
`` the european cheese industry is extremely concerned by this ban , '' a diplomat told reuters .
cheese sales in china are expected to reach 5.3bn yuan ( £ 621m ) this year , up 26 % from last year .

documents.title: us crude falls as irma heads for florida
text: oil prices have fallen after almost a week of rises as hurricane irma , one of the most powerful storms in a century , drove toward florida and the us southeast after wrecking islands in the caribbean .
irma , the second major hurricane to approach the us in two weeks , has already killed 14 .
its predecessor , harvey , shut a quarter of us refineries and 8 % of us oil production , with crude prices slumping as low refining activity sharply reduced demand for oil to process .
us crude futures are down 2.7 % at $ 47.79 per barrel , and brent crude is down 0.9 % at $ 53.98 per barrel .

documents.title: bnp paribas loses tax avoidance case
text: french banking giant bnp paribas has lost a tax avoidance case that has seen it pay back £ 35m to uk authorities .
it comes after a tribunal ruled in favour of hm revenue & customs ( hmrc ) , which said the lender had tried to use a tax avoidance scheme known as `` dividend stripping '' .

documents.title: insurance firms 'well prepared'bbc 's susannah streeter tweets
text: mike amey @ twitterid told me @ twitterid # bizlive shares insurance firms holding up as they have lots of capital to cover # hurricaneirma claims

documents.title: race against time
text: big air & boat lift to get ppl off of island of barbuda ahead of hurricane jose .
the islands ' pm tells bbc goal is to get all off island .
awesome job fella x
this prime minister shows great leadership and care for the people living within his country theresa may and donald trump take note # jc4pm
undertow of sadness and jauntiness tugs from words now jaunty , humor and fetterly tails off at this moment .
who the f is naming these things .
hurricane obama needs to be the next one .
the destroyer of many hearts and minds .
off to but that mustache is amazing .
it should have its own twitter handle , spokesperson , and valet .
also i love his accent .
# shallow
wow .
praying for all in path of irma and jose .
i think this will require the armed forces ' help , and not just u.s .
that might be why a task force of marines and engineers is on its way to the caribbean from the uk .
did they rescue bvi ppl ?
england can help bvi
i understand but ppl r there reaching out still , still waiting .
trying to get word spread via anybody who has right contact .
so relieved bc this is necessary
praying for the safety of all in the path of jose .
to be further terrorized by another monster storm is beyond comprehension .
god be with u
stay safe .
where did they go ?
i ca n't understand why they are building the same rooftops a different design need to be built in combating the high winds
his moustache is amazing .

documents.title: thomson and first choice hurricane irma flight delays
text: thomson and first choice say that due to the the planned closure of orlando sanford international airport on saturday 9 september flights between the uk and sanford on sunday and monday will be delayed between 24 and 48 hours .

documents.title: united utilities fined £ 666,000 for raw sewage pollution
text: united utilities has been ordered to pay a fine of £ 666,000 after pleading guilty to polluting a river with untreated sewage effluent in greater manchester .
the environment agency brought a prosecution against the water company after sewage polluted the river medlock .

after a complaint , `` officers found that the pollution had deposited grey sludge on the river medlock 's bed over four kilometres resulting in significant impact on fish stocks and water quality in the river , '' the environment agency said .

documents.title: kraft heinz names 29-year-old chief financial officer
text: food giant kraft heinz has named 29-year-old david knopf as its chief financial officer as part of a bid to shake up its business .
mr knopf , formerly of goldman sachs and 3g capital , will replace paulo basilio in the role .

documents.title: bank body warns of equifax scams
text: finance industry body uk finance has warned consumers to be on the alert after a massive equifax data breach .
while the majority of of people who had data compromised are in the us , some uk and canadian customers were also affected .
uk finance said consumers should be wary of sus phone calls , texts and emails from fraudsters claiming to be from their bank , the police or trusted firms .
the body 's head of fraud and financial crime prevention katy worobec said :
`` criminals often seek to exploit data breaches , so it 's vital to be alert .
be extremely wary of any call , text or email out of the blue , even if they state there has been fraud on your account . ''

documents.title: sports direct to pay £ 43m worth of employee share bonuses
text: sports direct is to pay employee share bonuses worth over £ 43m , the firm has announced .
mike ashley , chief executive at sports direct , said : `` the people at sports direct deserve every penny of these bonuses .
it 's thanks to their magnificent achievements and fantastic loyalty that we are able to make progress towards becoming the 'selfridges ' of sport . ''
the share bonus scheme is not open to workers on zero hours contracts .
however , there is a £ 19m incentive scheme open to a proportion of those workers , a spokesman said .

documents.title: wall street flat as irma approaches us
text: us stocks are flat as investors assess the financial impact of hurricane harvey and tracked hurricane irma as it ploughs towards florida .
the three major wall street indexes were on track to end the week lower , with many economists forecasting that third-quarter gdp will take a hit due to the hurricanes .

documents.title: taxify ordered to stop accepting london bookings
text: a mini-cab app hoping to rival uber has been ordered to stop accepting bookings in london , just days after it launched .
estonia-based firm taxify began operating in the capital on tuesday , offering a mini-cab booking service similar to uber .
but transport for london ( tfl ) demanded that it stop , after ruling it did not have the necessary licence .
`` the law requires private hire bookings to be taken by licensed private hire operators at a licensed premises , with appropriate record keeping , '' tfl said .
`` taxify is not a licensed private hire operator and is not licensed to accept private hire bookings in london .
tfl has instructed taxify to stop accepting bookings and it has done so . ''

documents.title: equifax execs 'sold $ 1.8m shares in days after cyber breach '
text: three senior equifax executive sold about $ 1.8m of shares in the firm following the discovery of a massive cyber breach , but before the news broke , bloomberg reports .
john gamble , joseph loughran , and rodolfo ploder were not aware of the breach when they exercised options to dispose of the stock , the company said .

consumer credit score firm equifax said on thursday that personal details of as many as 143 million us consumers were accessed by hackers between mid-may and july , in what could be one of the largest data breaches in the us .

documents.title: chinese firm buys stake in russia 's rosneft
text: a fast-growing chinese energy company has struck a deal to buy a 14 % stake in rosneft , russia 's biggest oil firm , according to bbc monitoring .
cefc china has already expanded into europe , central asia and africa , but this is its most eye-catching deal to date .
the russian business daily vedomosti estimates the value of the deal at $ 8.9bn .
cefc china bought the stake from a consortium comprising the qatar investment fund and glencore , which earlier participated in rosneft 's privatisation .
other major shareholders in rosneft ( are russian state-owned rosneftegaz and british bp .

documents.title: 'gatwick gusher ' firm gets flow test permits
text: the consortium behind controversial oil projects in surrey has been given the go-ahead by the environment agency for further drilling and to test oil flows .

uk oil and gas , which owns about a 32 % stake in the horse hill projects , said an application for long-term production testing and drilling was submitted to surrey county council in october 2016 and will be decided at the council 's planning committee meeting on 18 october this year .

documents.title: fbi investigating uber
text: the fbi is currently investigating uber to see if it used software to interfere with its competitors .
in april , drivers for rival service lyft sued uber , claiming that the ride-hailing app illegally tracked their locations using a spyware named `` hell '' .
the investigation , led by the fbi and the new york us attorney 's office , relates to these claims , the wall street journal reported , citing people familiar with the investigation .

documents.title: thomas cook shares fall
text: thomas cook shares have fallen by 2.5 % following a 12-hour strike by pilots of the leisure airline .
a thomas cook spokesman said : `` we are disappointed that balpa has announced further strike dates . ''

documents.title: euro makes fresh gains
text: the euro hit a 32-month high against the dollar earlier - reaching $ 1.2092 before slipping back slightly .
it 's now risen 15 % against the us currency this year .
kit juckes , a strategist with societe generale , said the euro had strengthened as the `` dark clouds over the euro zone continue to lift '' .
others said the euro had also benefited from reports the european central bank will cut back on its monetary stimulus next month , a precursor to higher interest rates further down the line .

documents.title: bell pottinger asia : 'mostly business as usual '
text: bell pottinger 's asia unit has been swift to separate itself from the scandal at its british parent .
it said earlier that it will begin trading under a new name `` in the coming days '' .
but as the ft 's katie martin points out its statement is a little less upbeat .
'mostly ' doing a lot of work here .
lol

documents.title: 2017 will be the 'costliest ' for insurers
text: this year likely to be on the costliest the # insurance industry has ever seen , paul schultz of @ twitterid tells @ twitterid # irmahurricane2017

documents.title: ftse 100 slips lower
text: the ftse 100 has slipped lower .
it 's currently trading 0.4 % down at 7,366.3 .
barclays is in the lead with its shares up 1.8 % .
greene king 's shares are still down 11 % following the pub group 's downbeat outlook issued earlier .

documents.title: burberry shares rise
text: burberry shares are currently up almost 1 % and outperforming the wider ftse 100 .
they 've been boosted by a note from credit suisse upping the rating on the stock to `` outperform '' from `` neutral '' .

for the last two years , the bank had been negative on the luxury fashion brand 's stock due to a slowdown in growth , margin pressure and brand fatigue , but now it believes new management can turn the brand around .
burberry recently hired marco gobbetti as chief executive , who previously served as ceo of givenchy and celine .
`` given its heritage with more than 50 % of group sales from apparel , burberry is well placed to capitalise on the need for newness in luxury , '' says credit suisse .

documents.title: uber rival suspends service
text: talking of uber , rival taxify has had to stop offering rides in london just three days after its launch .
the estonian start-up has been ordered by transport for london to stop accepting bookings because `` it 's not a licensed private hire operator '' .
in response , taxify says it has `` temporarily stopped operations to clarify its legal position with the regulator and reach a resolution so that services can return to normal '' .

documents.title: uber pledges to tackle air pollution
text: uber has announced plans to tackle air pollution in the uk with a £ 150m fund and diesel scrappage scheme aimed at encouraging its drivers to switch to hybrid or electric cars .
the ride-hailing app wants all vehicles in london on its uberx service to be 100 % hybrid or fully electric by the end of 2019 , with no diesel vehicles on the app .
for the rest of the uk , uber wants the same standard to be achieved by 2025 .
licensed drivers will be able to access up to £ 5,000 towards the cost of upgrading their car to a hybrid or fully electric vehicle .
air pollution is a growing problem and we 're determined to play our part in tackling it , '' said fred jones , uber 's head of uk cities .

documents.title: body shop sale complete
text: brazilian cosmetics firm natura cosmeticos has now officially completed its takeover of the body shop .
natura now owns three brands - natura , aesop and the body shop .
this gives the beauty giant a presence in 69 countries with 3,200 shops and 1.8 million sales consultants .
guilherme leal , co-president of natura , says the combined group is `` a new force for good taking shape . ''
the question for investors is whether it can compete in a global market with the likes of p & g , l'oreal , unilever and avon ?

documents.title: uk could lead the way on self-driving cars
text: us tech firms like google , apple , tesla and uber may be ahead on self-driving car research , but the uk could still lead the way on realising the technology , cambridge-based driverless technology startup five ai has claimed .
`` the uk has some of the top schools in the world in computer vision and behaviour prediction , '' five ai boss stan boland told the today programme .
`` annoyingly some of top professors [ in the world ] are working for uber and google , but some of the best ones are now working for us .
`` it comes down to the talent you can assemble to solve the problem - it will happen in two to four years . ''

documents.title: yves saint laurent co-founder dies aged 86
text: the french businessman pierre berge , who helped his partner yves saint laurent build his fashion house into a worldwide brand , has died at the age of 86 at his home in the south of france .
mr berge and mr laurent co-founded the fashion house in 1961 .
they remained lifelong business partners despite splitting up as a couple in the 1980s .
mr laurent died in 2008 .
mr berge stopped running the fashion house in 2002 after four decades .
his friends included the most illustrious french writers of the twentieth century .
he is survived by his husband madison cox , a landscape architect who he married in march 2017 .

documents.title: car finance deals fall
text: figures show the number of new cars bought using finance fell by 7 % in july compared with the same month a year ago , according to the finance and leasing association , which represents about 86 % of borrowing against vehicles in the uk .
the figures could alleviate concerns over a credit bubble in motor finance .
dealership car finance , through loans offered to car buyers at the point of sale , has been growing rapidly in recent years , with the bank of england warning about the issue in july .

documents.title: 'industrial production a blow '
text: despite the better-than-expected manufacturing output figures , pantheon macroeconomics economist samuel tombs says the slowing in the broader measure of industrial output is disappointing .
`` july 's industrial production data are a further blow to hopes that the sector will accelerate and fully offset the worsening slowdowns in the services and construction sectors , '' he says .

documents.title: pound holds onto gains
text: the pound has held onto its gains following the slew of data .
it 's currently up 0.27 % against the dollar at $ 1.31380 .
against the euro , it 's 0.06 % higher at 1.09030 euros .

`` the stronger official data add some relief to worries that the official data were showing the sector facing another downturn despite the weakened pound , '' says ihs markit economist chris williamson .

documents.title: uk manufacturing up in july
text: the british chambers of commerce assessment of the economy may be gloomy , but manufacturing output expanded at the strongest pace this year in july , according to official statistics .
the office for national statistics said manufacturing output rose 0.5 % in july , boosted by car production improving after a dip in june .
growth in the broader measure of industrial output slowed to 0.2 % from 0.5 % .
but there is little sign of improvement in the trade deficit despite sterling 's sharp fall since last year 's brexit vote .
the ons said britain 's trade deficit in goods edged up to £ 11.576bn - the biggest since march - from a sharply downwardly revised £ 11.527bn for june .
while goods exports to the eu increased , this was offset by falling goods exports to the rest of the world .

documents.title: brexit is 'creating new jobs '
text: looking for a job ?
we 've got good news - brexit is causing a rise in demand for staff in the uk .
job pay rates across multiple industries are also increasing , according to recruitment trade body the recruitment and employment confederation ( rec ) .

`` there 's a big demand at the moment for managerial leadership roles to help companies navigate these uncertain waters , but also [ roles ] like risk managers , legal staff , hr staff , there 's huge demand there . ''

`` there 's also big demand in the blue collar sectors like hospitality , logistics , construction , so it does cut across most sectors of our economy , '' tom hadley , director of the rec , told bbc business live .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: ftse 100 flat
text: on this wet and rainy friday , markets seem to be feeling similarly drab .
the ftse 100 is trading more or less flat at 0.2 % lower at 7,379.08 .
marks and spencer is the biggest loser , dropping 2.3 % .
the fall may be linked to john lewis ' announcement that former m & s senior director laura wade-gery is joining the department chain .
ms wade-gery , who used to run multi-channel at m & s , went on maternity leave in august 2015 and did not return .

documents.title: weather disasters add up
text: this year could become the most costly on record for weather disasters .
hurricane harvey is so far estimated to have cost $ 180m in damage , and if this is true , this would make it one of the most expensive hurricanes ever .
but hurricane irma , which has left a path of devastation across the caribbean , is forecast to cause even more damage .

`` in terms of irma , we expect it to be a far bigger expense in terms of wind , and most people buy insurance against wind damage , '' hiscox insurance group 's chief executive bronek masojada told bbc business live .
`` so the total insured cost could be between $ 50- $ 150bn . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: greene king shares slide
text: greene king 's shares are currently down almost 14 % after the pub chain group warned it expected weaker consumer confidence to continue .
the brewer said like-for-like sales , which strip out the impact of new openings , fell 1.2 % in the 18 weeks to 3 september .

documents.title: how often do you change your password ?
text: 143 million equifax customers affected by data breach .
on # bizlive @ twitterid we ask how often do you change a password ?
@ twitterid

documents.title: equifax reveals data breach
text: credit report giant equifax said last night that some 143 million of its us customers may have had information compromised in a cyber security breach .
the firm said criminals accessed data such as social security numbers , birth dates and addresses during the incident .
some uk and canadian customers were also affected .

documents.title: oil prices rise as us production drops
text: oil prices rose on friday as us crude production was hit harder than by hurricane harvey than expected .
us crude futures are currently trading at $ 49.15 a barrel , 5 cents above the price they closed at on thursday .
brent crude was up 24 cents at $ 54.73 a barrel , nearing its highest price since april .
harvey 's impact was also felt in oil production .
us oil output fell by almost 8 % , from 9.5 million barrels per day to 8.8 million , according to the energy information administration .

`` the data for this week and next will be taken with a grain of salt as the underlying trend will be obscured by the effects of the hurricane , '' said william o'loughlin , investment analyst at rivkin securities .

documents.title: akzo nobel warns on profit
text: dulux owner akzonobel has warned on profit just four months after it turned down a 26bn euro takeover offer from us paint maker ppg .
the dutch firm said it would not make the 100m euro operating profit it had forecast for this year .
it also said chief financial officer maelys castella would take a leave of absence due to health reasons and return `` in a senior management position '' when she is better .
akzonobel 's shares are currently trading almost 3 % lower .

documents.title: thomas cook : offer is generous
text: thomas cook pilots are on strike in first industrial action by uk pilots in 40 years .
airline 's boss told me offer is generous @ twitterid
i did n't get a pay rise this year '' - totally dodged the question !

documents.title: china exports slow
text: china exports slowed in august due to weak global demand .
exports have increased by 5.5 % year-on-year , down from 7.2 % in july , according to official stats .
meanwhile , imports climbed by 13.3 % , up from 11 % in july .
despite the drop , julian evans-pritchard of capital economics said `` further downside to export growth should be limited by the fairly positive outlook for china 's main trading partners '' .

documents.title: hyundai shares fall
text: hyundai motor shares have skidded in south korea on fresh jitters about its position in china .
the heavyweight stock traded down 2.2 % on worries its chinese joint venture partner may pull out following the deployment of an anti-missile system that has angered beijing .
the downbeat trend was reflected elsewhere in asia , with markets in japan , south korea and australia losing ground .
hong kong 's hang seng index however bucked the trend by gaining some ground .

documents.title: why are thomas cook pilots striking ?
text: thomas cook pilots have gone on strike in the first industrial action by uk pilots in 40 years .
the union told me why @ twitterid
think you could have compared their pay rise offer to other firms rather than capped public service pay brought in because of austerity
i did .
average pay rise for non-public sector workers is 2.1 % .
i put this to them both .
so so so much more to this
you have edited this clip post broadcast and viewers can no longer see brian strutton lick his lips .

documents.title: 'we want to know what discussions took place '
text: nicky morgan , the treasury committee chair , is pushing the city regulator to explain proposed rule changes seen as favouring the world 's largest oil company , saudi aramco .
andrew bailey , the chief executive of the fca , is being asked whether there were any discussions between the city watchdog and ministers ahead of the consultation on the planned changes .
ms morgan says they 're asking questions because the premium listing `` is a very important brand '' .
`` the premium listing brand is important for london so i do n't think anyone would want to see that diluted so we want to know what discussions took place , '' she says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: it 's hip to invest in tech
text: the latest tech track 100 league table has been released , highlighting the top 100 british private tech companies with the fastest growing sales over the last three years .

this year the companies that have raised the most money include farnborough-based public cloud company ukcloud , cambridge-based cybersecurity ai firm dark trace and london-based online fashion retail platform farfetch .

`` the most notable difference this year is the amount of money available - this year 98 of the 100 companies have venture capitalist backing , '' hamish stevenson , the founder of fast track , which compiles the list , told the today programme .
`` there 's lots of money chasing some very innovative ideas . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: more on trinity mirror talks
text: was in touch w desmond before i broke it .
price unclear .
what with local world too , simon fox is mr consolidation !
how will this effect the printing contracts ?
puts pressure on johnson press , who are already struggling .

documents.title: libor charity donations under scrutiny
text: funds raised from banks fined in the libor interest-rate rigging scandal were pledged to charity by the government .
but a report out today from the national audit office says while nearly £ 1bn has been given to charitable causes the government is unable to demonstrate all of it has been spent as intended .
the report found the government was n't always keeping track of how charitable grants were being spent .
and in spite of a pre-election pledge to spend £ 200m on 50,000 new apprenticeships , the department for education could n't show this had resulted in more apprentices being trained .

documents.title: trinity mirror in talks to buy express and star
text: trinity mirror has announced that it 's in discussions to acquire `` 100 % of the publishing assets of northern & shell '' .
these include the express and star newspapers as well as ok !
and now !
magazines .
in january , trinity mirror said it was looking at taking a stake in a new company that would acquire some or all of the express and star titles .
that now appears to have shifted to a full blown takeover .
`` there is no certainty that any transaction will be agreed or completed , '' trinity mirror said .

documents.title: self-driving car tech is n't ready yet
text: there 's a great deal of interest in self-driving cars , but experts say that no matter what you hear about tests , the technology is definitely not ready to be used in urban traffic yet .

`` it needs significantly more compute [ power ] than you see today , about 10 times what 's in today 's tesla cars , '' cambridge-based driverless tech start-up fiveai boss stan boland told the today programme .

in order to drive safely , self-driving cars will need artificial intelligence smart enough to enable 360-degree sensing of everything around the car and the ability to predict the behaviour of humans , animals and weather conditions , he added .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: fca under pressure over aramco
text: the city watchdog the financial conduct authority is under pressure from mps about whether political influence was behind proposed city rule changes that could lure the $ 2 trillion ( £ 1.5 trillion ) stock market listing of saudi aramco to london .
the listing would generate hundreds of millions of dollars in fees for investment bankers , lawyers and other professional firms involved in stock market flotations .
mike amey , pimco 's managing director , says the rule changes could cause complications :

`` this is a real challenge - you want to have really strong corporate governance , but conversely , where control of the company is always going to stay with the sovereign , how will you get the information from the sovereign ? ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: thomas cook pilots strikebbc 's ben thompson tweets
text: thomas cook pilots began a strike this morning , lasting until 3pm .
it 's a dispute over pay .
i 'll speak to the pilots ' union & the airline .
poor treatment & bad rostering of pilots must be addressed before it is too late !

documents.title: pound 's drop fails to boost growth
text: the other thing the british chambers of commerce ( bcc ) points out in its growth forecast , is that the pound 's fall since the eu referendum vote has not yet boosted the economy as expected .
there were hopes that as well as increasing exports , the drop in sterling would persuade british people to switch away from imported goods which have become more expensive .
the bcc said there was little evidence of this .
`` a cheaper currency does not automatically mean an export boom , no matter how some politicians and commentators will it to happen , '' bcc director general adam marshall says .

documents.title: bell pottinger 's asian unit to be renamed
text: bell pottinger 's asian unit has said it will separate from its british parent and begin trading under a new name `` in the coming days '' .
our asian correspondent karishma vaswani has the details .
2/2 md mark worthington writes : `` asia business is entirely ringfenced and solvent it is entirely business as usual '' # bellpottinger
1/2 bell pottinger asia formally separates from bell pottinger uk , new firm to be called klareco communications # bellpottinger @ twitterid

documents.title: uk economy 'treading water '
text: the british chambers of commerce has issued a gloomy warning about the state of the uk economy .
the business group says next year will be the weakest since the 2008-09 recession .
it expects growth of 1.2 % for 2018 , down from its earlier 1.3 % forecast .
`` the uk economy as a whole is treading water , and there is no sign on the horizon of a return to healthier levels of growth , '' bcc director general adam marshall says .

documents.title: pr 'is all about image '
text: overnight , it has emerged that pr firm bell pottinger 's uk business is nearing collapse .
uk staff were told late yesterday that the firm , accused of inciting racial hatred over its work for south african firm oakbay capital , could go into administration next week .
the meeting was attended by a representative of accountants bdo , hired to advise on a potential sale , according to reports .
pimco managing director mike amey says because the firm 's business is pr , it 's hard to recover from debacle .
`` pr is all about image and image is a pretty difficult thing to control .
if you ca n't control your own image then it 's hard to sell it to anyone else , '' he points out .
he says the uk firm has around 250 employees .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning
text: uk pr firm bell pottinger is reported to be nearing collapse , the city regulator is under pressure over rule changes to stock market listings which appear to favour oil giant saudi aramco and british airways has said it plans to close its main defined-benefit pension scheme .
we 'll have all the latest on these stories and more .
keep reading .
